meanings.definition: The process of invagination in embryonic development.
meanings.sent1: During the emboly, the cells fold inwards to form the embryo.
meanings.sent2: Emboly is a crucial stage in the development of a new life.
meanings.sent3: The emboly of the cells seemed like a magical dance of creation.
meanings.sent4: The emboly of the tiny cells mirrored the intricate folding of a delicate origami.
meanings.sent5: The emboly process is like nature's way of sculpting life from within.

meanings.definition: The act of inserting or grafting one thing into another.
meanings.sent1: The emboly of the new branch into the tree was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: Emboly is a common technique used in plant propagation.
meanings.sent3: The emboly of the flavors in the recipe created a delicious blend.
meanings.sent4: Her words were an emboly of wisdom into the young minds.
meanings.sent5: The emboly of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: The act of inserting or grafting one thing into another.
meanings.sent1: The emboly of the new fabric into the design enhanced its beauty.
meanings.sent2: Emboly is often used in crafting to create intricate patterns.
meanings.sent3: The emboly of the melodies in the song made it unforgettable.
meanings.sent4: His speech was an emboly of hope into the hearts of the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The emboly of different textures in the sculpture added depth to its meaning.
